intro: Carruanthus peersii, commonly known as the Sierra Nevada sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is characterized by its slender, branching stems and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant thrives in dry, sandy soils and is often found in open, rocky habitats. It is adapted to arid conditions, with a deep root system that helps it survive in drought-prone environments. Carruanthus peersii plays an important role in its native ecosystem, providing nectar for pollinators and contributing to local biodiversity.
